result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke E. Sliwicki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:49 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM365, 16CF618, 15CF499, AND 15CM286. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty John Wallace.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 16CF618: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF499: Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>DELETE 2nd and Subsequent Offense enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>DELETE 2nd and Subsequent Offense enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 9 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 10 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 11 (Possession of Controlled Substance/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 12 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 13 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM286: Ct. 1 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM365: Ct. 1 (Entry into Locked Coin Box/PTAC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF499: Amended Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 4 (Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 6 weeks. 
Sentencing hearing set for 9/12/2016 at 3:15 pm in Br. 3. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 4:05 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Luke E. Sliwicki
Current: 501 W Wausau Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2016)
Prior: 501 W Wausau Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Luke E. Sliwicki
Current: 501 W Wausau Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 11-05-2015)
Prior: 1108 S. 13th Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:08 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF499, 15CM286, AND 15CM365. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Erik Mcfarland. 

ARRAIGNMENT IN 15CF499. 
Information was previously filed. 
Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 

COURT advises parties to see JA to set future dates. 
Bond Continues. 

Adj: 1:09 pm

Case Called: 11:28 am
Includes 15CF499, 15CM365 (tracking), 15CM286 (tracking).
Clerk: Kassidi. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Erik McFarland.

Preliminary Hearing on 15CF499:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed in 30 days filed.  
Dates set:
 Future dates to be scheduled.
Bond:  Continued


BOND MODIFICATION:
COURT notes that Defendant has filed an Bond Modification. Atty McFarland states that he has filed a Bond Modification as well. 
Atty McFarland makes statement. State would object to any Bond Modification.

COURT ORDERS: $25,000 Cash Bond to $25,000 Signature Bond with first $5000 in Cash. CONDITIONS: Defendants father to Co-Sign on Bond, Day reporting to ATTIC, To reside with Father at the address given by Atty McFarland- 501 W. Wausau Ave. Curfew to be at residence one hour after finishing employment and one hour before employment. Anything required of the CHIPS Order is also in place. 

Adj: 11:38 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on May 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2015 at 02:10 pm.

INCLUDES 15CM286 & 15CM365   Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before PTC 4/14/15.   No contact with victim(s): Office Bar & co-defendant T.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
Defendant did not appear for initial appearance.

Case Called: 2:40pm. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES INCLUDES 15CM286, 15CM365. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant does not appear for Bonded Out Hearing today. State indicates bonded out for 15CM365 with 15CM286 returned date of 3/16/15. COURT ORDERS BW $250.00 ON 15CM365. Adjourned: 2:42pm.
